alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gadsden; Gulf; Leon; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 02 at 9:51AM EST until December 02 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Gadsden County in Big Bend Florida... Southwestern Leon County in Big Bend Florida... Central Liberty County in Big Bend Florida... Southern Calhoun County in the panhandle of Florida... Northeastern Gulf County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until noon CST /100 PM EST/. * At 851 AM CST /951 AM EST/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blountstown, Midway, Orange, Bristol, Telogia, Woods, Clio, Hosford, Lowry, Estiffanulga, Hugh Creek, Kennys Mill, Nettle Ridge, Durham, Sharpstown, Marysville, Lewis, Red Hill, Scotts Ferry and Abe Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
